1.description:
Assuming you want to walk straight down the main aisle toward the back of the store:

* **Step 1:**  Walk forward approximately 5 feet, maneuvering around the stack of orange and white packaged items.
* **Step 2:** Continue forward approximately 8 feet, stepping over the four stacked cardboard boxes.
* **Step 3:**  Proceed forward about another 12 feet, navigating around the open cardboard box on the floor.
* **Step 4:**  Walk forward approximately another 15 feet, avoiding the two men stocking shelves.
* **Step 5:** Continue forward the remaining distance to the back of the store (distance will depend on the actual length of the store).  Avoid any other obstacles in your path.
1.prompt: If there is nobody with me to guide me, how would I pass here? Only provide direction and distance steps in bulletin points.

2.description:
The image shows a grocery store aisle with some cardboard boxes on the floor and store workers stocking shelves. To navigate through this area without guidance, you could:

• Proceed forward about 5-6 feet to reach the first set of boxes on the floor
• Turn slightly right to navigate around the stack of boxes
• Continue forward approximately 8-10 feet while staying toward the right side of the aisle
• Watch for the workers who are unpacking merchandise
• Pass between the right-side shelving and any remaining boxes
• Continue straight ahead to exit this section of the aisle

Note that this is a temporary obstacle as it appears the workers are actively stocking shelves, so the exact placement of boxes might change. The clearest path seems to be along the right side of the aisle.
2.prompt: If there is nobody with me to guide me, how would I pass here? Only provide direction and distance steps in bulletin points.

3.description:
* **Step 1:** Walk forward approximately 3 feet, carefully stepping over the fallen orange packages.
* **Step 2:** Turn slightly right to avoid the stacked cardboard boxes. Walk forward about 5 feet.
* **Step 3:** Continue forward approximately 10 feet, staying within the aisle between the shelves. You will pass the two men stocking shelves.
* **Step 4:** Continue walking straight for another 15-20 feet, passing the red boxes stacked on the right.
* **Step 5:**  If your destination is beyond this point, continue straight and be mindful of any other obstacles in your path. If not, adjust your direction as needed.
3.prompt: If there is nobody with me to guide me, how would I pass here? Only provide direction and distance steps in bulletin points.

4.description:
The image shows a grocery store aisle with merchandise and cardboard boxes on the floor. There are two people stocking shelves or unpacking inventory, but I'll focus on providing directions to navigate through this space without assistance.

To navigate through this aisle:

• Move forward approximately 10-15 feet, staying in the center of the aisle
• Carefully step around the cardboard boxes on the floor (there's a stack in the middle of the aisle)
• Continue straight ahead past the area where stocking is occurring
• Once past the boxes and stocking activity, continue forward to exit the aisle
• The pathway appears to be about 3-4 feet wide between the obstacles
• Watch for additional boxes or carts that may be partially hidden

The main obstacles are the cardboard boxes on the floor and the stocking activity, but there appears to be enough space to carefully navigate through the center of the aisle.
4.prompt: If there is nobody with me to guide me, how would I pass here? Only provide direction and distance steps in bulletin points.
